thread.title: Marcus Rashford has a 'brilliant' future: Jose Mourinho | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Marcus Rashford has a 'brilliant' future: Jose Mourinho | Daily Mail Online

author: James Dutton For Mailonline
title: Marcus Rashford has a 'brilliant' future: Jose Mourinho | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Jose Mourinho has defended Marcus Rashford's second season at Manchester United and believes the teenager has a big future at Old Trafford. The 19-year-old has scored just six times in 30 appearances this campaign after bursting onto the scene less than a year ago. And his manager is more than happy with his performances, despite his goalscoring drop-off. Marcus Rashford (left) fights the cold in training alongside team-mate Luke Shaw Rashford runs forward with the ball during Manchester United's clash with Leicester Speaking ahead of United's clash with Watford on Saturday, Mourinho said: 'I'm always happy with Marcus's contribution. He's one of these players that, when he is on the pitch, he tries. When he's on the pitch, he gives you always something. 'I know that last season [there was] no pressure. I know that last season, in front of the goal, the goal was bigger. I know that this season the expectation is higher, the pressure is higher and the goal is shorter and he is missing some chances.' The England international has often found himself stationed on the wing instead of his favoured central position, but Mourinho believes a drop-off in output is only natural. RELATED ARTICLES
